DataElement.preferredName: Cancer Identification Diagnosis Laterality Number Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the side of a paired organ, or the side of the body on which the reportable tumor originated.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The side of a paired organ, or the side of the body on which the reportable tumor originated. This applies to the primary site only.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004:Identified; having the identity known or established.

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.
The procedure of having an identity established.

Property.preferredDefinition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.:Behavioral manifestations of cerebral dominance in which there is preferential use and superior functioning of either the left or the right side, as in the preferred use of the right hand or right foot.

Concepts.definition: The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation.
Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

DataElementConcept.origin: NAACCR:North American Association of Central Cancer Registries

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure._Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: PAIRED SITE, BUT NO INFORMATION CONCERNING LATERALITY

ValueMeaning.preferredName: PAIRED SITE, BUT NO INFORMATION CONCERNING LATERALITY
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: PAIRED SITE, BUT NO INFORMATION CONCERNING LATERALITY

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: ONLY ONE SIDE INVOLVED, RIGHT OR LEFT ORIGIN UNSPECIFIED

ValueMeaning.preferredName: ONLY ONE SIDE INVOLVED, RIGHT OR LEFT ORIGIN UNSPECIFIED
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: ONLY ONE SIDE INVOLVED, RIGHT OR LEFT ORIGIN UNSPECIFIED
Left; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the west when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Right; being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

Concepts.definition: Being or located on or directed toward the side of the body to the east when facing north.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Bilateral involvement, lateral origin unknown; stated to be single primary; including both ovaries involved simultaneously, single histology; bilateral retinoblastomas; bilateral Wilms' tumors.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: The distinguishing qualities or prominent aspect of a person, object, action, process, or substance.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Behavioral manifestations of cerebral dominance in which there is preferential use and superior functioning of either the left or the right side, as in the preferred use of the right hand or right foot.:Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.
A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
